title: COMPUTER BLOOD 2.0
description:
The second program installment of Computer Blood features moving image video work that plies the territory of technology, internet art, and computer art — it's work that is disseminated online — and work that blurs the lines between new & experimental media, video art, and cinema.

Featuring a subsequent performance by Nick Briz.

After party sounds by Violet Systems with visuals by Effie Asili.

Curated by Andrew Rosinski.
(TRT 81 min, plus performances)
Screening in sequential order.

pieces.title: Gradient Core
pieces.description: A colorful romp through the world of digital gradients.  (AR)

pieces.title: Solo Show in Sim City
pieces.description: Solo show in Sim City brings art to a virtual place that has been developed as video game. It acts inside the limited boundaries of the game and lives from its unique aesthetic.  (KA)

pieces.title: Flashings In The Mirror
pieces.description: Flashings In The Mirror concatenates many found photos — older era “selfie” photos — into rhythmic and moving sequence, wherein each camera flash provides hypnotic eye trace .  (AR)

pieces.title: Erotic Playing Cards
pieces.videoinfo: New Haven, CT | 2013 | 13 min | video | color | sound
pieces.description: "Erotic Playing Cards, Russian, 2007" is a video that visually investigates a deck of erotic playing cards, printed in Russia, in 2007. The video exposes the "original" versions of the photographs printed on the cards [of softcore pornographic models of mostly Russian, Ukrainian, and American origins] by utilizing the Google "Search by Image" function.  (DB)

pieces.title: HD1080
pieces.videoinfo: Chicago, IL | 2013 | 2 min | video | color | sound
pieces.description: A digital collaboration between Bea Fremderman and Lauren Elder, with audio by Chris Gooris.  (AR)

pieces.title: How To / Internet
pieces.description: Part of an ongoing series of instructional videos by Jaakko Pallasvuo.  (AR)

pieces.title: Places with Meaning
pieces.description: An active film typeset in the wingdings font, originally printed to 16mm, now on video, and an interesting reversal of sorts that provides a rare computer-on-celluloid aesthetic.  (AR)

pieces.title: UTC-2
pieces.videoinfo: Chicago, IL | 5 min | video | color | sound
pieces.description: Recorded a man in Ama, Japan to see what he could see.  (ML)

pieces.title: LCD
pieces.description: A melange comprised of found footage of broken LCD screens. (AR)

pieces.title: Context Aware
pieces.description: The term 'content aware' is thrilling, terrifying. As when the first killer realized that what is now gone is never really gone.  (EM)

pieces.title: Travelogue
pieces.description: A walk through of the Garfield Park Nature Conservatory takes psychedelic turn. (AR)

pieces.title: Self Portrait With Plant.obj
pieces.description: Wayward morphing fronds and frothing audio grow lush with vitality in this video self-portrait by Rick Silva.  (AR)

pieces.title: Natasha
pieces.description: Stock photo giant Getty Images is notoriously aggressive in policing licenses to their images. A minor infraction (or false positive in their image tracking software) will trigger a barrage of threatening legal letters and invoices demanding exorbitant licensing fees and penalties. These demands have never been held up in court, leading many to call their tactics simply "speculative invoicing," an act of strong arming the unaware and defenseless, mafia-style, into "paying up."  This experimental documentary (sourced from an online forum post and created entirely with unlicensed Getty Images) brings their questionable practices to life.  (CC)

pieces.title: Cheerleading Machine
pieces.description: Alexandra Gorczynski works in a wide variety of traditional and digital media to make work that reflect aspects of our heavily networked and digitized lifestyles. Computer imagery and aesthetics are prevalent in her collage and painting, while her video works move between mundanity, scandal, surrealism, and sincerity to explore the phenomenon of private spaces on public fora.

pieces.title: Waiting For Anne
pieces.videoinfo: NYC, NY | 2010 | 6 min | video | color | sound
pieces.description: An intimate moment is shared between a young woman and man. (AR)

pieces.title: Finder Fantasy
pieces.description: A lurid, phantasmagoric fantasy featuring Apple's spinning finder wheel.  (AR)

pieces.title: Our Relationships Will Become Radiant
pieces.description: Three narratives unfold together. Inside a vast nature reserve sits a solitary building, a café, where an important meeting is being held by executives. Outside in the park - the collective singular lounge about wearing fancy garments. Images are exchanged, participation simulated: the interminable present. Meanwhile, the dormant wildlife fades away.  (JL)
